segments.name: A H BETU
segments.text_excerpt: Az irosoftverek nevei H-val kezdodnek. A Hemingway volt az elso... Igy lett a H betu az irodalom gyilkosa. Amikor az elso iroszoftver mukodese lepett... Az olvasok ugy kaptak ra a szoftverregenyekre, mint gyerekek a csokoladara.
segments.emotional_beat: Cold dystopia — literature's death announced through typography, the H letter as executioner
segments.visual_description: Vast monolithic H letter dominating frame, brutalist architecture, endless rows of identical book spines generated by machines, cold blue light emanating from screens, fog and rain, near-future industrial literary factory
segments.color_notes: Steel grey, cold blue, industrial white — the death of human creativity visualized through oppressive architecture
segments.motion_prompt: very slow fog drift around monolithic H structure, subtle rain streaks, distant automated machinery rhythm barely visible, cold breath of industry, contemplative oppression

segments.name: AZ IRO
segments.text_excerpt: Az iro mar oreg volt, es immar tiz eve, hogy nem irt semmit. Johannes Klebe-nek hivtak... semmi sem volt oreg rajta, csak a szeme, mert a szeme parja szomoru volt, es megtort. Johannes gyulolte az iroszoftvereket... a teste hiaba volt fiatalos, ha belul a lelke egy maganyos oregembere volt. Az intelligens macskat is a magany miatt vasarolta.
segments.emotional_beat: Loneliness incarnate — young body, ancient soul, the weight of obsolescence
segments.visual_description: Interior of Johannes's coastal home, aged man with young body sitting motionless, large orange intelligent cat nearby, scattered old books and manuscripts, amber lamp light fighting against grey daylight from ocean-facing windows, dust particles floating
segments.color_notes: Warm amber from old lamps vs cold grey coastal light — the battle between human warmth and cold new world, Edward Hopper solitude
segments.motion_prompt: nearly still, dust motes drifting in amber lamplight, cat's tail barely moving, ocean light shifting slowly through windows, breathing stillness, profound loneliness visualized

segments.name: A BALKON
segments.text_excerpt: Mi a te a neved? Bebhionn. Miert nem irsz, Johannes? Oreg vagyok mar az irashoz. Felsz, igaz?... Te lehetsz az utolso iro. Nem ertem. Memet kell csinalni beloled. Igazi kuriozum lehetnel: az utolso human iro. Es ami ritka, arra nagyobb a kereslet.
segments.emotional_beat: The turning point — the cat offers a path, becoming the last of something rather than nothing
segments.visual_description: Balcony overlooking grey ocean, Johannes and Bebhionn in silhouette against vast horizon, seagulls taking flight, wind picking up, light beginning to shift from cold to warmer — possibility entering the frame
segments.color_notes: WITHIN-SCENE SHIFT: Start cold grey ocean view, slowly warming toward amber as Bebhionn speaks of becoming the last writer — hope through transformation

production_notes.motion_philosophy: Predominantly minimal. Scene 1 and 2 are near-still living photographs. Scene 3 has moderate motion (seagulls, wind, color shift) to mark the emotional turning point.
production_notes.character_notes: Johannes Klebe: 150 years old, genetically young body but ancient broken eyes. Bebhionn: orange intelligent cat, philosophical, drives the plot forward.
